section.title: Description
section.p: [US Standard Certificate Of Death Fields 24 - 31]. The opinion or determination, based on a physical assessment, that life has ceased. A series of steps that need to occur to determine that a death has occurred. Involves examining patients to determine death, notifying families and in recording proper documentation of a death. Death pronouncements are generally conducted by a physician.

stentry.p: [US Standard Certificate Of Death Field 29 and 30]. Contains the actual or presumed date and time of death as completed by person who pronounced or certified the decedent's death.
[US Standard Certificate Of Death Fields 24 and 25]. Date and time that the decedent was pronounced dead.
[US Standard Certificate Of Death Field 28]. Date that the person who pronounced or certified the decedent's death signed the Certificate of Death.
[US Standard Certificate Of Death Field 31]. Indicates whether the medical examiner or coroner was contacted.
[US Standard Certificate Of Death Field 27]. The person who pronounced or certified the decedent's death.
